policy_implementation_assessment.justification: The data shows clear adverse impact against females and Hispanic/Black applicants, violating section 4.6 which requires at least 80% selection rate for protected groups compared to the highest selection rate group.
specific_violations: Section 4.6 - Selection rates for females (57% of male rate) and Hispanic applicants (23% of white rate) are well below the 80% threshold
Section 4.3 - Lack of diverse representation in interview and hiring outcomes suggests interview panels may not be sufficiently diverse
recommended_actions: Review and revise recruitment strategies to attract more qualified diverse candidates
Implement blind resume screening to reduce potential bias in the initial selection process
Provide additional training to hiring managers on recognizing and mitigating unconscious bias

complaint_trends.seasonal_patterns: Hiring Discrimination complaints appear more frequently in Q1 and Q2, possibly correlating with seasonal hiring cycles.
